refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Mvclpf3 is an digital implementation of the 4th-order (24 dB/oct) Moog ladder filter originally written by Fons Andriaensen. According to the author, mvclpf3 "is based on mvclpf2 , with two differences. It uses the the technique described by Stilson and Smith to extend the constant-Q range, and the internal sample frequency is doubled, giving a better approximation to the non-linear behaviour at high freqencies. This version has high Q over the entire frequency range and will oscillate up to above 10 kHz, while the two others show a decreasing Q at high frequencies. Mvclpf3 is reasonably well tuned, and can be 'played' as a VCO up to at least 5 kHz".

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: asig mvclpf3 ain, xcf, xres[, istor]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: istor --initial disposition of internal data space. Since filtering incorporates a feedback loop of previous output, the initial status of the storage space used is significant. A zero value will clear the space; a non-zero value will allow previous information to remain. The default value is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xcf -- filter cutoff frequency. The useful range is around six octaves below and above middle C (pch 8.00).
xres -- resonance, limited to the interval [0,1].
